dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Sorry, I'm kind of up to my elbows in work here, I don't know if I have much advice to contribute to this situation.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Have you considered that there is a flaw in the business plan? If Provider 2 is straying from it so often, it might need to be reevaluated.

feedback.revise_business_plan_3: I will schedule a meeting this week and begin the revision process for next quarter.
feedback.retrain_1: I will make some time this week for a retraining session.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I really don't think that this is in my wheelhouse; maybe somebody else on your team would have a better idea?

community_verifier.dialogue: Wow, uh, I'm not really sure what I would do in your shoes. That might be in somebody else's job description, though.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: TWe need to spend money where it's needed, and I know where it is needed. That was the purpose of granting us autonomy in the first place.

feedback.warning_8: I will do my best, but I don't see a sustainable path forward with the current plan.

health_provider_3.dialogue: The business plan is far too restrictive! You need to give us all more latitude in how we spend the funds you give us.

twists.name: Reversal
twists.initiating_dialogue: Hello! Again, I must say I am very pleased to be working with you. My customers though, are less happy. They are reluctant to go to your hospitals even though I refer them. Couldn't you train someone here to do the work?

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: I really don't think that this is in my wheelhouse; maybe somebody else on your team would have a better idea?

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I am not comfortable with procedures taking place by new workers and trainees unsupervised. I might approve stationing a nurse at traditional medicine facilities.

coach.dialogue: If they won't come to facilities, having trained people near them is better than nothing. Why not expand our outreach program instead, though?

feedback.embed_nurses_1: An interesting idea. I'll help facilitate this as best I can, It would be much easier to increase outreach staff, though.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: Wow, uh, I'm not really sure what I would do in your shoes. That might be in somebody else's job description, though.

community_verifier.dialogue: People are reluctant but I believe they could be swayed to come to facilities. I recommend keeping the program as it is.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Sorry, I'm kind of up to my elbows in work here. I don't know if I have much advice to contribute to this situation.

feedback.expand_outreach_program_1: It will take some time to do this, and there is a shortage of qualified people, but I will do my best.

feedback.train_locals_1: Excellent! I have a good feeling about you, friend.
feedback.stick_to_the_plan_1: I warn you, they will not accept it.

twists.name: Inconsistent Indicators
twists.initiating_dialogue: We are seeing some indicators rise while others stay stagnant. Hospital births are barely rising, though ANC checkups and vaccination rates are improving. We need to see all indicators rising!

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Hiring more outreach nurses to staff facilities near communities is my suggestion.

feedback.expand_travelling_nurses_2: This makes a good deal of sense to me.

coach.dialogue: Perhaps the indicator goals need to be reviewed at the end of the year?

feedback.revise_indicators_at_end_of_year_3: It might make sense to revise these goals down.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: Wow, uh, I'm not really sure what I would do in your shoes. That might be in somebody else's job description, though.

community_verifier.dialogue: People here are still reluctant to travel to facilities.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Vaccinations are easier to manage. Births take more planning. More resources are likely required to make this work.

feedback.incentivise_facility_births_1: That will make this a good deal easier for us.

health_provider_3.dialogue: You should accept more traditional techniques into your program. People should have the choice, don't you think?

twists.name: Overflow
twists.initiating_dialogue: We have more referrals than expected from the traditional medicine practitioners. It looks like some people are visiting clinics when it is not necessarily needed.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: I'm not sure working with these people was the best idea. Maybe we should seek another partner for next year.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We need to send a clear message that this is unacceptable. Strong sanctions are what I recommend.

coach.dialogue: The guidelines are obviously not clear enough to either the new provider, the patients, or both. We need to issue updated guidelines that are clear.

feedback.create_new_guidelines_1: Hopefully a little bit of clarity will get things back on track.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: Sorry, I'm kind of up to my elbows in work here, I don't know if I have much advice to contribute to this situation.

community_verifier.dialogue: It sounds like Provider 3 is taking advantage. This is not going to build trust in the new system.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Maybe I should stop honoring these referrals, or scrutinize them more carefully at my level?

feedback.increase_scrutiny_1: I will need some assistance to put these protocols in place.

health_provider_3.dialogue: I am only doing what you asked, and referring people to the hospitals. What is the problem?

feedback.warning_9: Many apologies! I think I now understand the problem.
feedback.sanctions_4: Why do I even refer people if you punish me afterwards? This is foolish.
feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_4: But we have only just begun! Pray, please reconsider.

twists.name: Wrong Numbers
twists.initiating_dialogue: I have been reviewing the Clinic's records, and they do not check out. These problems with their numbers have been going on for two years now.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If needed, we could end the contract, let us do some serious investigation if this is necessary.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I've had some communication with Mr. Todd in the past, but I believe he is honest. You should talk to him directly to see what the problem is.

coach.dialogue: This is the first time we've seen this behavior from Mr. Todd. I'd recommend a warning.

community_verifier.dialogue: I can confirm the numbers do not match up. Very suspicious.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I don't think the clinic should get preferential treatment over my hospital. Treat them just as you would treat us.

health_provider_3.dialogue: I think my staff is confused about what to report. Frankly, I myself have been confused at times!

feedback.warning_7: I'll talk to my staff and try to settle this.
feedback.sanctions_4: I just put in orders for new equipment. Now I won't be able to afford to pay for them. I think you are taking this too far. It was an honest mistake.
feedback.hold_meeting_to_retrain_on_reporting_pra: I think that will probably help. Let me know when works for you and I'll clear some time.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If the Ministry is claiming this is necessary, I would take it seriously. A compromise might be to re-work the RBF Manual, and training with Ministry oversight.

coach.dialogue: I have found some mismanagement of funds in the past as well, but appropriate actions were taken. We are supposed to be granting autonomy. Also, remember that the providers are paid for the services already provided.

community_verifier.dialogue: I don't understand the need for these new guidelines, but then again, I am not working in the hospital.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: We are verifying the result and ensure that the providers get paid accurately. So why take away their autonomy?

health_provider_3.dialogue: I need to be able to purchase whatever is needed. This is a return to the bad old days, with many delays in receiving supplies from the central level, and I can't agree with it.

feedback.revise_business_plan_4: I don't believe this will be constructive, but I'm willing to try.

twists.name: Field Records
twists.initiating_dialogue: We believe that the outreach nurses in the field could be used more effectively. Currently, there's not sufficient data that shows they are going to where they are most needed. Better record keeping could help us use them to their fullest potential. We can't confirm they are meeting goals or having positive impacts on indicators.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: It might help if they were clearing their movements through my office. Then we would know where they are going, and that they are headed where they're needed.

coach.dialogue: I would focus on capacity-building around the use of data. Even with all the data in the world, if no one is able to analyze it, it might as well not exist.

feedback.centralize_control_over_travelling_nurse: I'm wary of adding another level of bureaucracy to this, but it may help...
feedback.data_capacity_building_1: Alright, if you really think this will help, I'm willing to give it a chance.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The records filed by outreach nurses are sloppier and often late, since they are in the field instead of the hospital.

community_verifier.dialogue: I really wish I had an answer for you, but I can only give you data, not tell you what to do with it.

feedback.warn_community_verifiers_1: We'll try to come up with a strategy to tackle this. It can't be insurmountable.

feedback.require_nurses_to_return_to_file_1: Many of my facilities are not much better than the field, and it will add to our own filing burden.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Our nurses are doing good work. If the Ministry can't confirm it's having an effect, then it's a verification issue.

health_provider_3.dialogue: This is the job of the verifiers, not us.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: A warning might not be enough here. Sanctions seem appropriate.

coach.dialogue: This is only their first year. A warning might do the trick.

twists.initiating_dialogue: The fourth quarter reports are in and our review has found many suspicious claims from Provider 4. This is becoming a habit, and needs to stop.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This provider has been nothing but trouble. I recommend terminating this contract.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Severe sanctions seem to be in order. This facility has been raising red flags all year.

coach.dialogue: Honestly, this clinic specialist has been terrible to work with. I do not look forward to working with them again in the future. Terminating the contract may be warranted.

community_verifier.dialogue: I have heard from some people that this clinic specialist has the worst service in Zariba.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Sorry, I'm kind of up to my elbows in work here, I don't know if I have much advice to contribute to this situation.

health_provider_4.dialogue: The mistake is on the other party. I have been doing everything by the book.

feedback.sanctions_8: So I pay for the verifier's mistakes? Ridiculous.

prompt_year_1: Thank you for joining us for the end of year meeting. It seems like your program implementation is going smoothly, yes? That said, we would like to know if you need anything approved through us to make the program run more efficiently. We are currently delivering services through an NGO, though if things aren't going as well it isn’t too late to switch to a PBF system.
prompt_year_2: You've made it to the end of year two. I hope you are checking your indicators and making sure the RBF program is running smoothly. I understand you’re personally invested in the NGO, but I foresee problems down the line. Is there anything you need from us?

choices.text: Change from a PBC focused program to PBF focused program by firing the NGO

problems.name: Lack of Procedure
problems.initiating_dialogue: With all these changes, my providers have expressed a lot of general confusion about who does what. Can you clarify this for me?

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Let's get this clear once and for all, who does what.

feedback.create_manual: This will make things much more clear. Thank you.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I can improve on the manual the ministry has put out.

feedback.clarify_roles_1: Let's meet together with the ministry so that we make sure that it is really clear.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: It would be good to deal with this before the different agencies start getting testy with each other.

community_verifier.dialogue: I'm worried this confusion is going to affect the care people are getting.

coach.dialogue: It's always handy to have something written down for people to look at.

feedback.hold_a_meeting_of_all_stakeholders_1: I'll talk to everyone and make sure they understand what we tried to get across about the different roles.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I keep getting different answers from the NGO and the Ministry about roles. Can you talk to them about it?

problems.name: Process versus Results
problems.initiating_dialogue: Look. I know we haven't hit the targets you set in the contract, but we did get a lot of good work done. We can easily hit our targets next quarter if we receive our bonus for this period.

feedback.warn_but_allow_payment_once_1: This will help us do even more good work!
feedback.deny_payment_1: We're working with little enough as it is.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If they didn't hit the targets, we shouldn't pay them.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If they think giving them the money for what they did get done will help next time, we can pay them this once.

coach.dialogue: I'm worried that if we give them the bonus this time it'll set a precedent.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: They were upfront about not meeting your goals, but it's your decision.

community_verifier.dialogue: I understand that results get paid, but if we don't pay them, my people won't get any treatment, let alone too little.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: They're trying. I'm seeing it in my hospitals.

problems.name: Government versus Organization
problems.initiating_dialogue: The NGO is giving us the run-around when we ask to counter-verify their reports. You need to get them to realize their presence here depends on their transparency.

feedback.cease_counter_verification: If you think they don't need more looking into, that's fine, I trust you.
feedback.clarification_of_roles_1: Next time, let's try to avoid this by making everyone's job clear beforehand. Thanks.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I'm with the Minister on this, I want to know what the NGOs are doing.

ngo_manager.dialogue: We verify everything, I promise. We also give third-party access to the verification, there is no need for the government to also verify.

feedback.pressure_the_ngo_to_comply_1: It takes a lot of time for us to comply with all these verifications. I'm worried we won't have time to meet our targets if we're busy with paperwork.

coach.dialogue: The issue of verification doesn't have to do with anyone but the NGO and the Third Party Verifier. Negotiate with them.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: We don't need the government to counter-verify. We're handling it.

community_verifier.dialogue: I think there's enough oversight. This shouldn't be the role of the Ministry.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: It wouldn't be a lot more paperwork for us to submit for counter-verification, but I don't know that it's necessary. Is the third-party verifier not providing a copy to the government?

problems.name: Managerial Autonomy
problems.initiating_dialogue: The NGOs will not reach their targets unless they hire more staff to work in the hospitals, otherwise they will be unable to provide good quality of care.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We have a pretty good sense of how staffing worked and where we can improve it if you give us the authority to recruit.

ngo_manager.dialogue: This is results based financing. We're responsible for the results, so let us decide on how to use the financing.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_2: It would be helpful for you to reiterate that we have autonomy on how to use the resources to achieve the target results.
feedback.move_authority_to_ministry_1: I really thought we were supposed to handle this, but if they Ministry wants to, that is fine.

coach.dialogue: We can probably handle this without a lot of drama. Just remind everyone what they're supposed to be doing.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm seeing the hospitals struggling, but that might just be growing pains.

community_verifier.dialogue: My only concern is people not getting care because the budget keeps getting tied up in arguments.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We definitely need more staff. I've already highlighted this to the NGO.

problems.name: Process Versus Results
problems.initiating_dialogue: Fuel prices went up so we had to reduce our outreach to manage costs, and therefore we couldn't reach our targets. But if we don't get our bonus next quarter it'll be even worse.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: The NGO wants autonomy so you'll have to do your research on what to do.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: No, they didn't meet their targets, but that doesn't mean my providers and patients should suffer for it. We're between a rock and hard place.

feedback.warn_but_allow_payment_once_2: It's good to know we can count on you in an emergency, just like you can count on us.
feedback.deny_payment_2: We're struggling with achieving these targets as it is. It hurts patients when we don't have enough money to work with.

coach.dialogue: I don't think the NGO is managing as well as they could. They really should have contingency funding, but maybe in the end they really do need more resources.

feedback.revise_indicators: OK, at year's end I'll sit the purchaser down together with the NGO and we'll figure out some realistic targets and prices.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I can confirm that they are not meeting their targets, but other than that, I'm not much help.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day I followed up with a woman who vaccinated her son against dengue right before the mosquitoes got bad. The numbers aren't great, but if the payments stop, it will make the situation worse.

clinic_manager.dialogue: If there is no money to do outreach, I don't know how we can reach and treat people. I'd love to get more people in, but I'm glad for what we are doing.

problems.name: Reach
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're seeing under-served populations throughout the south. The NGO really seems to be falling short of their promises, at least in this area.

feedback.increase_funding_for_ngo: You realize you're rewarding these people for failure? Please make sure that this is the right decision.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The health care providers and the NGOs are working hard, but there are many social and cultural barriers to our progress in this region.

ngo_manager.dialogue: It's been a lot harder to reach some populations than we expected, especially down there. The people in the South are more entrenched in traditional medicine, and that's a big obstacle for us to get over when we can only afford the health care itself.

feedback.contract_additional_ngo_at_years_end: I think we could have done it, but it would be a lot of work to reach that province in the south, so I think this is for the best.
feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_1: We cannot get to absolutely everyone, so you're making it impossible to get health care for everyone else.

coach.dialogue: Look, we have one group running things pretty well for most of the country. Maybe we need another NGO who is more used to this kind of region, to focus our efforts on the population.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm sure they are having trouble getting to some people, but it's impossible to reach everybody.

community_verifier.dialogue: You can always just guide the NGO on how they should address this. It might be kind of micro-manage-y, but that's what you have a coach for, right?

hospital_administrator.dialogue: That is why you brought this NGO in, to get people treated. There might be someone who could do it better.

problems.name: Arguments
problems.initiating_dialogue: I don't even know what's going on, but our stakeholders are bickering and it's causing problems.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: I'm tired of the NGO acting up at every opportunity, and I'd really rather not deal with them anymore.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_3: That's sorted out. Just, you know, be sure you're writing all this down so next time these issues don't crop up.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The NGO keeps trying to order me around as if they don't know the roles and responsibilities

ngo_manager.dialogue: I didn't realize I was overstepping my boundaries. It would be good for everybody if we could clarify the roles and responsibilities.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_2: I don't understand why you brought us on in the first place if you were going to fire us for doing the work.

feedback.hold_stakeholder_meeting_2: Considering that the problem in the first place was everyone sniping at each other, I guess the meeting went pretty well.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I can't be of much help with this. It helps for me to be pretty neutral.

community_verifier.dialogue: I am so tired of all this finger pointing. You have to be too, I know.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: The way I see it, and this is just my opinion, is that the people at the NGO and the Director of Regional Health Services are the ones who need to figure this out. I just want to run my hospitals.

problems.name: Unit Costs
problems.initiating_dialogue: Look, I don't really know what you and the NGO have worked out, but I need to be authorized to purchase supplies at the right costs. Can you tell them to lighten these restrictions some?

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We've spoken directly with the NGO a number of times on this. We are emphatic when we say we control the drugs, not them. They should focus on delivering services.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We've been whittling down whose job is whose throughout this process, so you don't have to tell me this isn't my place, but were it up to me, I'd cancel the NGO contract.

ngo_manager.dialogue: We are doing our best to deliver these services, but the government controls the drugs, not us. We try to treat as many patients as we can, but if the Ministry strangles our supply, it doesn't work.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_4: OK. I'm just trying to make this work as smoothly and efficiently as possible.
feedback.loosen_drug_control_1: That will help a great deal. This way we can ensure the proper medications get where they need to go, at the right cost.

coach.dialogue: I'll ask, because this seems to be an ongoing problem: is that the NGO's position? They seem to be overstepping their role.

feedback.move_authority_to_ministry_2: The Ministry already has a lot going on, but I guess they can handle local hospital budgeting, too.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: If they can't agree on a budget, I'm not going to have any cases to verify. And I like my job.

community_verifier.dialogue: If I were you, and I'm offering this as someone who lives here, ask the Ministry and your coach what to do. The Ministry gets the last call and the NGO doesn't.

problems.name: Contract Management
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're still waiting on the fund holder to pay us. The Finance Minister's approval process has hamstrung us, and we need to get our money to pay our people.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This is just another sign that our relationship with this NGO is not working. If it's not working, the contract should be terminated. We can work directly with providers.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I get where the Dep. Minister is coming from, but I see people getting treated. We need to get everyone on the same page.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_3: I get it that this has been stressful, so this might be for the best, but I hope you can handle this. For the patients' sakes.
feedback.expedite_payment_and_service_delivery: Thank you. This is going to work much better.

coach.dialogue: The cause is obvious: bureaucracy in the Ministry of Finance. They should know that we pay for results, and every time they delay funding, it causes a feedback loop that hurts results down the line..

feedback.clarification_of_roles_5: Sure, you can remind the Ministry and NGO, again, who's supposed to do what. But that will only work until the next argument.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm sure you're getting good advice from the people who are writing the checks. They are, at least, smart enough to know what they want.

community_verifier.dialogue: The people that will know this best are the coach and the health provider. They deal with the impact of these decisions every day.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Get the NGO their money! I have no empty beds! The doctors and nurses keep asking me when we're going to be able to do something about it and the best I can tell them is, well, I try to explain how all this is supposed to work. And that explanation doesn't do anything for a head wound.

problems.name: More Arguments
problems.initiating_dialogue: I'm getting a different answer from everyone, so I'll ask you to straighten them out. The Ministry, NGO, and health care providers can't agree on who has jurisdiction where and what we're supposed to do for patients.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Best way to win an argument? End the conversation.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_6: I do hope this is the last time we have to go through this.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I'm only doing what I thought you asked me to. If I'm not, let me know.

feedback.warn_ngo_3: OK, we'll try to stick with the national protocols, but our track record proves that ours are very successful.
feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_4: The whole reason you brought us on was nothing was getting accomplished. That's what we were doing.

coach.dialogue: The contract says that the NGO should be using the national protocols, but it looks like they are using their own set of guidelines. You should talk to them, and the ministry, to work this out.

feedback.hold_stakeholder_meeting_3: For a problem like this, a truce is about as good as we can hope for. Well, maybe not a truce, as such. More of a cease fire.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: There's plenty of work to be done without these arguments.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day, a woman was getting her prenatal checkup. She's waiting in the examination room for the doctor to arrive, but he was almost thirty minutes late because someone from the NGO was lecturing him on what kind of care to give. That has got to stop.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I couldn't do what the NGO Director does. No argument there. But they are in my country, they should respect our health guidelines.

problems.name: Excuses
problems.initiating_dialogue: I feel we've been misled about the situation on the ground here. Rising fuel prices are one thing, but the cultural barriers we've had to deal with are beyond what were initially described. I am confident we can meet our targets next year, but only if we get our bonuses this year. Otherwise, the entire program is doomed.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: They claim they're doing a terrific job. Are they?

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: It's a lot easier to work with people when they're getting paid.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I'm only doing what I thought you asked me to. If I'm not, let me know.

feedback.warn_but_allow_payment_once_3: It's good to know we can count on you, just like you're counting on us.
feedback.deny_payment_3: We're struggling with these numbers as it is. It hurts patients when we don't have money to work with.

coach.dialogue: Maybe they're doing the best that can be done. I don't know. It can't hurt to make sure we're being realistic in our expectations.

feedback.revise_indicators_at_end_of_year_2: OK, at year's end let's all sit down and we'll figure out what would be realistic goals for the money we have to work with.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: Have you read 'Things Fall Apart'? It might be a good idea.

community_verifier.dialogue: You're within your rights not to pay the NGO, it's true. But people have a right to health care.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: As much as I've disagreed with the NGO, I'd like to continue treating patients.

problems.name: Training Protocols
problems.initiating_dialogue: We recently requested some very simple information from the NGO, and they refused to supply it. We have yet to see their training curriculum on information flow, and we're beginning to wonder why.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: This curriculum is of particular interest to us since information flow and control are crucial, and we want to know how their employees are trained on this so we can approve it.

ngo_manager.dialogue: Are we required by the contract to furnish this information? It's our property, after all, and we have a vested interest in keeping our processes private.

feedback.warn_ngo_6: I hear what you're saying, but I don't intend to change our practices unless it's mandated.
feedback.clarification_of_roles_7: I thought our roles were already clear. I still see no reason to furnish this information. Why should the government approve something so granular?
feedback.include_approval_ngo_curriculum_1: If you really think it's necessary, we'll make this information public and allow the Ministry to approve it.

coach.dialogue: If the contract and the business plan do not state who has a right to this information, perhaps it should. At the start of the new year, let's revise this to make it clear.

community_verifier.dialogue: I have no idea how their organization operates internally, sorry.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: This seems like a dispute between the NGO and the ministry. Talk to them about it.

problems.name: Over-Reporting
problems.initiating_dialogue: Over-reporting has become an issue in the last few months. I'm not sure why it's happening, but there's no getting around it. We're being billed for work that's not getting done.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We've struggled with the NGO in a number of ways, and this is the last straw as far as I'm concerned. Terminate the contract.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I can imagine what the Dep. Minister told you, but I'm going to advise sanctioning them. They've been with us for a while now, after all.

ngo_manager.dialogue: We made a lot of new hires this quarter to meet increased demand. This is a good thing! Our new staff members aren't executing the program as planned, but we can deal with that. I'll pass your warning on.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_6: We've been getting kids vaccinated against fatal diseases, improving care, saving lives. That is what you are screwing up here.
feedback.sanction_ngo_2: I don't know what you expect me to do with more sanctions. I'm trying to manage a complex network!
feedback.warn_ngo_7: I will pass this warning along. I promise it will be taken seriously.

coach.dialogue: This is very troubling. I would refer you to the Ministry for advice, as the responsibility of the project eventually rests with them.

community_verifier.dialogue: This is kind of a mess. I don't want this to turn into a bigger problem than it has to be.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I have no knowledge of this. If the NGO is over-reporting results, it is happening at their level, not mine.

prompt_year_1: Thank you for joining us for the end of year meeting. It seems like your program implementation is going smoothly, yes? That said, we would like to know if you need anything approved through us to make the program run more efficiently. We have reports that granting providers more autonomy is a viable modification to this program.
prompt_year_2: You've made it to the end of year two. I hope you are checking your indicators and making sure the RBF program is running smoothly. Is there anything you need from us? Granting more autonomy to providers is still a viable measure if you feel it would help us hit our indicator goals.

choices.text: Modify program to grant providers more autonomy

problems.name: Slow Verification
problems.initiating_dialogue: The independent verifier and the health providers seem to have built a coalition to box us out of the verification process. This RBF program gives us the authority to verify any and all reports, but they're pushing back.

feedback.ask_reduce_oversight: This isn't what we had in mind when we started the project. I don't see how we can, in good faith, approve costs we haven't verified.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We need the authority to verify like we always have. It seems unethical to OK payments that we haven't verified.

feedback.streamline_speed_verification_process: This will put some strain on our office, but I think we can get the extra work done.

coach.dialogue: The program spreads authority across multiple stakeholders, including the Ministry of Health. Whether it's a good thing or a bad thing, that's their concern. Let's send a memo gently reminding everyone of that.

feedback.circulate_memo_reaffirming_ministry_auth: I'll make sure this gets into everyone's mailbox as a high priority. Don't worry: I won't write the subject in caps lock again.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: It's my job to verify reports. Having someone else double everything we're doing is worse than redundant: it's counter-productive.

feedback.warn_verifier_1: All right. We'll let everyone look over our shoulders all they want. But to say it's inefficient is an understatement.

community_verifier.dialogue: We're tired of submitting our reports in triplicate. We have enough to do without all this paperwork.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I like working with the government, I do. But doubling verification doubles the time before I get my money, and my budget is pretty tight as it is.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Having three levels of verification sounds like overkill to me. And my staff is confused about who's actually in charge.

problems.name: Poor Management
problems.initiating_dialogue: The hospital administrator and I were reviewing the hospital's business plan and they do not seem to manage funds well. Even with our payments they're operating at a loss.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: There are other health providers in the region we could use. A sanction will remind them.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The plan's faltering a bit. Are you sure this is the hospital's administrator's fault and not some issue with the business plan? It might be on us.

feedback.review_business_plan: Making a reasonable plan with things we can achieve together will put us on the right path.

feedback.sanctions_11: Alright, but I think this is a little much for so early in the game. I'll keep an eye out and maybe we can avoid this happening again.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: It seems this hospital has not been able to increase their performance very well.

community_verifier.dialogue: I would talk directly to them if I were you. Maybe they're seeing something we aren't.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I don't know about the hospital, we're trying to meet goals without a lot of supplies or money to buy more.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We're doing our best here. The program is complicated, and not all my people have had time to look at it while treating patients, filing their records, that sort of thing. We'll get used to operating within the budget soon.

feedback.warning_and_retraining_2: We are trying to work with the money we have. We don't need to be chastised for that.

problems.name: Bad Record Keeping
problems.initiating_dialogue: The Clinic submitted their reports on indicator performance to us, but there appear to be some inconsistencies. When we asked to see their records, they could not supply them.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If they are not following the rules, they should not be paid. A penalty may also be in order.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: All providers in my region know the requirements for keeping records. Something must be wrong. I'd talk to them.

coach.dialogue: Can't imagine why they aren't keeping records. Last time I talked to them, they said everything was fine and they didn't want my help.

feedback.capacity_building_help: When I'm over there next I'll check on their on-the-spot training, figure out where they're making mistakes.

community_verifier.dialogue: My team has had no issue keeping records. I wonder what the issue is at the clinics?

clinic_manager.dialogue: I am surprised, I thought the reports we submitted were correct. It would be really helpful if someone could explain the mistakes we are making.

feedback.hold_payment_2: I understand you have to do this. We'll make due and improve next quarter.
feedback.sanctions_12: I don't think the answer to our staff problem is to cut our allocation. This will affect patient treatment.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Perhaps they just need some more time to get used to all of this. Cut them some slack this once, and they'll figure it out as we go.

problems.name: Lack of Supplies
problems.initiating_dialogue: Bad news: We're running surveys of patients from the hospitals and local clinics, and at every focus group, someone reports being turned away without services.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If people are being turned away, it's because funds are being mismanaged. Sanctioning them may be the only thing that providers will pay attention to.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: This is a serious problem. Even if services were abundant, it's hard to get people to come to the hospital.

feedback.increase_supply_budget: We've increased the budget every year and that hasn't solved the problem yet. That isn't to say our health care providers are the problem, only that it might not be budgetary.

coach.dialogue: I'm not sure why, but these facilities are always low on supplies. Maybe they just need more money.

feedback.grant_facilities_autonomy: I'll see to this. In addition, we should issue a recommendation to the Ministry about the usefulness of autonomy in these facilities in general, as this is clearly not well-understood.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The numbers are poor, but at least the facilities are being honest about it.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I've spoken to the RBF coach about this a number of times. If we don't have basic supplies, we cannot treat patients.

feedback.unlocks_sanction_providers: You can't seriously be asking us to do more with even less. It costs money to provide quality care.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We put in requests for supplies, but it's forever before they're filled. And when they do, we get too much of some things, and not enough of others. If we could simply order or purchase our own supplies directly, this wouldn't be a problem, but the Ministry says what we're allowed to get down to the last syringe.

feedback.warn_providers: I'm at a loss. I'll hold a meeting with my staff and the RBF Coach, try to figure out how to solve this.

problems.name: Staff_Issues
problems.initiating_dialogue: In many of my focus groups, there's an air of mistrust of the hospitals and clinics. People who go have experienced terrible service and are telling their neighbors not to go.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This has gone on long enough. It is time to take action and reprimand the providers.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Providers in my region complain often of over-stressed staff. They have too few people working with a lack of supplies, and that's bound to affect service.

coach.dialogue: Customer service is a huge part of quality of care. Increase incentives, whatever we need to do, we have to get staff to be nicer to patients.

feedback.increase_customer_service_incentives: I'll let everyone know. I wouldn't mind something like this around here, linking the patient satisfaction to the bonuses. Hey, if I smile more, will you give me a raise?

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I keep hearing these horror stories. A man told me a nurse yelled at his son when he was scared of getting an injection. That's unacceptable. It might not be my place to say so, but firing staff and hiring new people might be appropriate.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I've spoken with my staff about this on a number of occasions. Even with incentives in place, if they can't meet expectations patients can't be made happy. Sure, understaffing is part of it, but we don't have the medicine we need half the time. People get angry when we don't have anything to give them.

feedback.warn_providers_2: We're overworked as it is. But fine. I'll see what I can do.
feedback.reorganize_staff: It's great that you can hand down these decrees of who I may and may not hire. I'm sure that while my new phlebotomist keeps sticking people, they'll do it with a smile.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I can tell my staff to be nicer, but they're working hard to meet goals, deal with patients who come in frustrated, and all on a shoestring budget.

feedback.sanctions_13: Making it harder for me to do my job is not the answer to our problems. We need to fix the actual problem. No, I don't know what that would be, because I'm trying to hold a hospital together.

problems.name: Mismanagement
problems.initiating_dialogue: I was visiting the hospital for my coaching visit, and they are still not following the clear guidelines about how to manage the funds. I think the guidelines are pretty clear, why are they not sticking to them? The business plan has clear guidelines they are not sticking to.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: It sounds like funds have been mismanaged.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Have you considered that there is a flaw in the business plan? If the Hospital Administrator is straying from it so often, it might need to be reevaluated.

feedback.revise_business_plan_6: I will schedule a meeting this week with the purchasing agency and begin the revision process for next quarter.
feedback.retraining_on_use_of_financial_tools_2: I hope the Hospital Administrator will see its importance. I'll make some time this week for a retraining session and try to drill down on exactly how these tools should be used.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm not saying the coach isn't perceptive, but if a cursory look around the hospital is all you need to tell something's not right, it's probably not fraudulent.

community_verifier.dialogue: I doubt they're trying to pull one over on you. I had the worst time with my finances all through my 20s; managing money is hard.

clinic_manager.dialogue: We're all short staffed, but I've found ways to make it work.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I can't control my hiring budget, and my supplies remain squeezed. I'm short staffed and constantly running out of things. So how can I possibly meet the demands of this business plan?

feedback.sanctions_18: I'm doing my best, but I don't know how long I can hold onto my staff like this.

problems.name: Transparency
problems.initiating_dialogue: There is an ongoing issue with the Clinic Manager. They looked like small stuff, but since they've had issues with record keeping, I looked more closely. I found some forms that are exact duplicates of others, which means they're filing duplicate reports to boost their numbers.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We cannot afford this kind of impropriety. Deal with this.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: This is troubling. I may begin looking into other providers for you to contract next year.

coach.dialogue: This is a big deal. Honesty aside, we need accurate numbers to know what kind of progress we're making. We need to send a very clear message: unvalidated reports will not be paid.

feedback.warning_14: I'll warn them. Hopefully we won't see this again.

community_verifier.dialogue: That's not my department, exactly, but it sounds pretty suspicious.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I told my staff to start keeping better records. I can talk to them again and stress its importance...

feedback.sanctions_14: Our budget is strained as it is. I'll have to fire people. Which will make it harder to meet your goals. And so on until we have to close and your program fails.
feedback.terminate_contract_1: This is a disaster! For such a small error?

hospital_administrator.dialogue: Don't go too hard on them. These clinics do good work.

problems.name: Midwives
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're having a lot of trouble increasing our numbers for facility births. We're short staffed, especially when it comes to midwives.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If you can verify this, we'd be willing to discuss the budget.

feedback.grant_providers_autonomy_to_hire_staff: This is a significant change to the program. Let's discuss this at the end of the year once we see how it's panned out.
feedback.request_a_budget_line_from_ministry: We can allow this, but I want to see reports on the results.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: That would explain the struggling indicators on facility births.  An alternative I've considered is providing vouchers for travel to bring people directly to facilities.

coach.dialogue: The Hospital Administrator has complained to me in private about not being able to hire staff members without Ministry approval. I told him the program is firm about how these decisions are made.

feedback.offer_vouchers_for_travel: This will remove an important barrier, though I still worry that we are short-staffed at facilities.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: You should talk to the Clinic Manager: they're working under similar conditions and should have insight. Run it by your RBF Coach, too.

community_verifier.dialogue: I've heard this complaint from several women in my community. They say there are long waits to meet with midwives. Everyone seems stressed out. Pregnancy is trying even in the best of conditions.

clinic_manager.dialogue: We have had a similar problem here. And since you mention it, granting us the autonomy to hire whatever staff would go a long way to fix this.

problems.name: Budget Lines
problems.initiating_dialogue: I received a memo today on the new national health budget. The ministry released new hiring guidelines for all providers, but they don't match the goals you gave us.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Our monitors have found mismanagement of funds. Hospitals should provide the necessary services with what we give them to work with.

feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers: Hiring and firing is within the scope of regulation, which is my role. But if you think it's essential, we'll step back.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If the Ministry is claiming this is necessary, I would take it seriously. A compromise might be to re-work the business plan with Ministry oversight.

coach.dialogue: We've been running into this problem for three years now. The only way I see this working in the future is cutting the Ministry out of the picture and letting providers hire staff.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I have noticed some inconsistencies in the data that indicate funds are being mismanaged. The providers might benefit from tighter rules.

community_verifier.dialogue: I don't understand the need for these new guidelines, but then again, I don't work in the hospital.

clinic_manager.dialogue: The RBF Coach shares my concerns about micromanagement, so I know that I'm not going crazy seeing a problem in how things are getting run. We need you to do something before this becomes a real fight.

feedback.rework_business_plan: I don't believe this will be constructive, but I'm willing to try.

problems.name: Failed Inspection
problems.initiating_dialogue: Hey, the third party verifier just came to assess our quality score, but I disagree with the assessment results. Given the amount of strain we are under, I believe we need to be granted some leeway in order to serve patients.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Quality of care is important insofar as it enables better and more services to be delivered. It might be that the clinic is delivering as much good care as they can given their circumstances.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I recognize that their job is difficult, but quality of care is one of the indicators we are working to improve.

coach.dialogue: Quality of care is not something we should grant leeway on. It is crucially important. If they are under such strain, they may require extra staff.

feedback.review_the_inspection_2: I will coordinate this review, but I still think they need to stick to the business plan.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: They scored poorly, plain and simple. A review is not necessary.

community_verifier.dialogue: These are small clinics, with very little operating budget. Denying payment will cause immediate harm to the community.

feedback.revise_business_plan_7: I would appreciate some support from the coach on how we can improve things here.
feedback.deny_review_2: You are not taking me seriously. How can I have faith in this system?

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I can tell you it is painful to lose out in the payment because of the quality score, especially when things are busy. What harm is there in reviewing the inspection?

problems.name: Prescriptions
problems.initiating_dialogue: I've been interviewing patients, and at least at the clinics there's a serious quality of care issue. People have been leaving with what appears to be completely wrong prescriptions.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: That's unacceptable. I think it's time we looked for someone else to fulfill these duties. There are other health care providers in Zariba.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We must conduct an investigation right away. Begin by speaking directly with the health providers and find out why this is happening.

feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_8: I understand. I will inform the Clinic Manager of this, and begin the search for a replacement ASAP.

coach.dialogue: Maybe we've been incentivising the wrong things. Prescriptions make patients happy, whether or not they're correct. I've prioritized satisfied patients, perhaps to the detriment of best practices.

feedback.reduce_incentives_for_customer_service: That's an approach I hadn't thought of. Let's implement it, see what happens.
feedback.tie_incentives_directly_to_protocol: I'll work on implementing this change. I think this'll be a turning point for the program.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: How did I miss this!? I'll take another look. It would be very easy for us to verify whether they're really following protocols.

clinic_manager.dialogue: I run an entire network of clinics, and unfortunately I can't be everywhere at once. In the end, I am responsible, but I feel I am not being given the support I need.

feedback.warning_16: You're asking me to discipline my clinics for avoiding fights with patients who think medicine means walking out with a bottle of pills. I also have to discipline them for not making patients happy. I'll try to figure out some way to balance those.
feedback.sanctions_15: You cut our funds when patients complain, which they do because we don't prescribe them drugs. Then, when we give them what they want, you cut our funds again. You need to figure out what you want.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: At first I was shocked to hear this, but the more I thought about it, the more it makes sense. Patients don't know the difference, and if we're incentivizing happy patients, the wrong medicine is better than no medicine.

problems.name: Missing Goals
problems.initiating_dialogue: I'm disappointed to say this, but things are not going well. Providers are not performing well, and our indicators have not risen as predicted. We're thinking about cancelling the program for next year. This would mean a return to traditional financing.

feedback.grant_providers_autonomy: Let's schedule a meeting to discuss this at the end of the year. I might be able to persuade the Minister to give us one more year with an altered program.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: As much as it pains me to say so, I agree with the Deputy Minister. We need to change our approach.

feedback.return_to_traditional_financing: Part of me feels like the past three years have been wasted, but I guess there's no sense in throwing good money out after bad. It's been a pleasure working with you.

coach.dialogue: There must be another solution here. I'm committed to making this program work. Even with new health providers taking on contracts.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm seeing some good done at the ground level, but I have no idea how that reflects nationally.

community_verifier.dialogue: I can tell you that, if the problems I keep seeing in paperwork are any indication, you're in trouble. Then again, filling out forms and caring for patients aren't the same thing.

clinic_manager.dialogue: My clinics could handle this better if you shifted some resources away from the hospital to us. Let me do my job and I will show you.

feedback.terminate_both_health_contracts_of_provi: If I couldn't make this work, nobody can. But I wish you good luck.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I heard through the grapevine what's happening. I know there have been issues, but I believe the problem is and has been bureaucracy from the Ministry's offices. If you grant us autonomy to hire staff as needed and order supplies to fill our patients' needs, things have to improve.

feedback.terminate_hospital_contract_and_redirect: Well. This is disappointing. I was doing everything I could to make this program work.

prompt_year_1: Thank you for joining us for the end of year meeting. It seems like your program implementation is going smoothly, yes? That said, we would like to know if you need anything approved through us to make the program run more efficiently. We are currently delivering services through an NGO, though if things aren't going as well it isn’t too late to switch to a PBF system.
prompt_year_2: You've made it to the end of year two. I hope you are checking your indicators and making sure the RBF program is running smoothly. I understand you’re personally invested in the NGO, but I foresee problems down the line. Is there anything you need from us?

choices.text: Change from a PBC-focused program to PBF-focused program by replacing the NGO with public services

problems.name: Slow Verification
problems.initiating_dialogue: I need a little help here. The program has just begun and already we're seeing delays in payments. This does not bode well.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: The delay is in our verification, unfortunately. We haven't hired a third party yet, so only the first level of verification is complete.

feedback.speed_third_party_hire_1: We realize this is important, and we'll make every effort to ensure it goes smoothly.
feedback.request_expedited_payment_1: We're working at capacity to get this done. Things are just taking a little longer than we planned.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: I'm not sure what the delay is. I'd speak with the Deputy Minister or the Third Party Verifier.

feedback.speed_third_party_hire_1: You hired us to manage this! Why not give us a chance?

coach.dialogue: These delays will cause a cascade of failures. I recommend expediting payments to avoid a negative feedback loop.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: We're waiting on some paperwork to clear before we're officially on the job. As soon as this decision is finalized and we get our contract, we'll take care of it.

community_verifier.dialogue: The Ministry takes forever to do anything. They need to be prodded, I think.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I have a good relationship with the government, but double-checking takes twice as long. That means it takes twice the time for us to get paid, and my budget can't take that strain.

problems.name: Process V. Results
problems.initiating_dialogue: Look. I know we haven't hit the targets you set in the contract, but we did get a lot of good work done. We can easily hit our targets next quarter if we receive our bonus for this period.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If they didn't hit the targets, we shouldn't pay them.

feedback.increase_budget_for_supplies_1: This will need approval from the Finance Ministry, but it could improve things. Still, the claims should not be paid this quarter.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: If they think giving them the money for what they did get done will help next time, we can pay them this once.

feedback.allow_payments_once_4: This will help us do even more good work! Thank you.
feedback.deny_payment_4: We're working with little enough as it is. If we can't reach our goals with what we have, what makes you think we'll do better with less?

coach.dialogue: I'm worried that if we give them the bonus this time it'll set a precedent.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: They were upfront about not meeting your goals, but it's your decision.

community_verifier.dialogue: I understand that results get paid, but if we don't pay them, my people won't get any treatment, let alone too little.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: They're trying. I'm seeing it in my hospitals. The problem is with our supply line. If we had the necessary supplies, we could easily meet these goals.

problems.name: Government Vs. Organization
problems.initiating_dialogue: I'm getting a different answer from everyone, so I'll ask you to straighten them out. The Ministry, NGO, and health care providers can't agree on who has jurisdiction where and what we're supposed to do for patients.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: Best way to win an argument? End the conversation.

feedback.clarification_of_roles_11: I do hope this is the last time we have to go through this.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I'm only doing what I thought you asked me to. If I'm not let me know.

feedback.warning_17: Okay, we'll try to stick with the national protocols, but our track record proves that ours are very successful.
feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_7: The whole reason you brought us on was nothing was getting accomplished. That's what we were doing and now you're telling us not to.

coach.dialogue: The contract says that the NGO should be using the national protocols, but it looks like they are using their own set of guidelines. You should talk to them, and the ministry to work this out.

feedback.hold_stakeholder_meeting_5: For a problem like this, a truce is about as good as we can hope for. Well, maybe not a truce, as such. More of a cease fire.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: There's plenty of work to be done without these arguments.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day, a woman was getting her prenatal checkup. She's waiting in the examination room for the doctor to arrive, but he was almost thirty minutes late because someone from the NGO was lecturing him on what kind of care to give. That has got to stop.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I couldn't do what the NGO Director does. No argument there. But they are in my country. They should respect our health guidelines.

problems.name: Lack of Supplies
problems.initiating_dialogue: Bad news. We have surveyed many patients from the hospitals and local clinics, and at every focus group, someone reports being turned away without services.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: If people are being turned away, it's because funds are being mismanaged. Sanctions may be the only thing that makes a difference.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: This is a serious problem. It's hard enough getting people to hospitals even when services are abundant.

feedback.increase_supply_budget_2: We have increased the budget every year. I am not optimistic this will solve the problem.

ngo_manager.dialogue: If the government would just let us do the purchasing, then we would not run low on supplies and have to turn patients away.

feedback.warn_ngo_4: Warning received. I'll discuss this with our health providers and work on a solution.
feedback.grant_facilities_autonomy_2: This problem is due to facilities mismanaging what they are given, not my budget lines. It's not a good idea to give them more responsibility when they've done such a bad job with what they have.
feedback.sanction_ngo_3: How are we supposed to accomplish anything if you keep handicapping us? You understand this is going to affect care outcomes.

coach.dialogue: Maybe the budget for the medical store has been set too low?

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The numbers are poor, but at least the facilities don't appear to be exaggerating them.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We put in requests for supplies, but they are not filled in a timely way. We get too much of some things, and not enough of others. If we could order or purchase our own supplies directly, this wouldn't be a problem, but the Ministry sets our orders down to the exact number of syringes.

feedback.increase_ngo_autonomy_1: I'm at a loss. I'll hold a meeting with my staff and the RBF Coach and try to figure out how to resolve this.

problems.name: Staff Issues
problems.initiating_dialogue: In many of my focus groups, there's an air of mistrust with the hospitals and clinics. People who go there have experienced terrible service, and word's getting around.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We're paying for the NGO to provide increased quantity and improved quality of services, and if they are not doing that we should sanction them.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: Providers in my region have complained often of over-stressed staff. There are not enough workers, and supplies are still running out frequently.

ngo_manager.dialogue: As long as the Ministry is not allowing us to hire staff it is difficult for us to improve the situation.

feedback.warn_ngo_5: I'll do what I can, but we're struggling as it is. I don't know how we can improve without being able to hire staff ourselves.
feedback.increase_ngo_autonomy_2: Thank you! Hopefully we can start to make some progress here!

coach.dialogue: Customer service is a huge part of quality of care. If staff aren't doing it now, we need to increase incentives.

feedback.increase_customer_service_incentives_2: I'll notify everyone about the change. I think we'll see a big difference soon.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: Providers struggle to meet their quality of care milestones. Bad service is half the problem. It might not be my place to say so, but firing staff and hiring new people might be the best way to go.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I have less control over my staff than you might think. When we struggle to fill demand on a day to day basis, there isn't much time left over for morale-building and discipline.

feedback.reorganize_staff_2: More orders from on high about who I can hire? Just thinking about how long it will take to train all these people to where my current staff is makes me mad. And that will happen after I fire my people.
feedback.sanction_ngo_4: You realize that when you sanction the NGO, the money tends to come out of my budget? You cannot keep doing this to us.

problems.name: Reach
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're seeing underserved populations throughout the South. The NGO is falling short of their promises, especially in this one area.

feedback.increase_funding_for_ngo_2: You realize you're rewarding these people for failure? Please make sure that this is the right decision.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: The health care providers and NGOs are working hard, but there are many social and cultural barriers in this region.

ngo_manager.dialogue: It's been a lot harder to reach some populations than we expected, especially down there. The people living in the South are more entrenched in traditional medicine, and that's a big obstacle for us to get over when we can only afford the health care itself.

feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_9: We cannot get to absolutely everyone, so you're making it impossible to get health care for everyone else. That's self-defeating!
feedback.contract_additional_ngo_2: I think we could have done it, but it would be a lot of work to reach that province in the South, so I think that this is for the best.

coach.dialogue: Look, we have one group running things pretty well for most of the country. Maybe we need another NGO who is more used to this kind of region, to better focus on the population.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm sure they are having trouble getting to some people, but it is impossible to reach everybody.

community_verifier.dialogue: You can always just guide the NGO on how they should address this. It might be kind of micro-manage-y, but that's what you have a coach for, right?

hospital_administrator.dialogue: That is why you brought the NGO in, to get people treated. There might be someone who could do it better. Maybe you should revisit the contract at the end of the year?

problems.name: Budget
problems.initiating_dialogue: The NGOs will not reach their targets unless they hire more staff to work in the hospitals, as otherwise they are not able to provide good quality of care.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We have a pretty good sense of how staffing was working and where we can improve it if you give us back the authority to recruit.

ngo_manager.dialogue: This is results-based financing. We're responsible for the results, so let us decide on how to use the financing.

feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers_2: That's fine by me, but let's discuss it at the end of the year. It's a pretty big change.
feedback.move_authority_to_ministry_3: I really thought we were supposed to handle this, but if the Ministry wants to, that's fine.

coach.dialogue: Hate to say it, but the NGO has too much power over the budget. We should alter the program to allow providers to make these decisions at their level.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I'm seeing the hospitals struggling, but that might just be growing pains. Missing goals for one quarter isn't the end of the world.

community_verifier.dialogue: My only concern is people not getting care because the budget keeps getting tied up in arguments.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: We definitely need more staff, I have already highlighted this to the NGO.

problems.name: Midwives
problems.initiating_dialogue: We're having a lot of trouble increasing facility births. We're short-staffed, especially when it comes to midwives.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: This might be our most important indicator. Our infant mortality rate is abysmal, and if more money gets those numbers down, I'll argue for it.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: That would explain the struggling indicators on facility births. An alternative I've considered is giving more assistance for travel, to get people to come to the facilities.

feedback.advise_to_follow_budget_restrictions_1: OK, we'll make do. We always have.

ngo_manager.dialogue: If you can verify this, we'd be willing to discuss the budget.

feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers_3: We'll do whatever you think is best, though this is a pretty major change. Let's discuss this at the end of the year.
feedback.request_budget_for_more_midwives_1: We can allow this, but we'll pay close attention to the results.

coach.dialogue: The Hospital Administrator has complained to me in private about not being able to hire staff members without NGO approval. The program is set up that way, but if we granted them autonomy to make hiring choices, things would run more smoothly.

feedback.travel_vouchers_1: This will remove an important barrier, though I still worry that we are short-staffed at facilities.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: The RBF Coach has been in regular contact with the Hospital Administrator, they might be able to offer a perspective on things.

community_verifier.dialogue: I've heard this complaint from several women in my community. They say there are long waits to meet with midwives. It puts strain on everyone. Pregnancy is trying even in the best of conditions.

problems.name: New Budget
problems.initiating_dialogue: Look, I don't really know what you and the NGO have worked out, but I need to be authorized to purchase supplies at the right costs. Can you tell them to lighten these restrictions some?

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: We've spoken directly with the NGO a number of times on this. We are emphatic when we say we control the drugs, not them. They should focus on delivering services.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We've been whittling down whose job is whose throughout this process, so you don't have to tell me this isn't my place, but were it up to me, I'd cancel the NGO contract.

ngo_manager.dialogue: We are doing our best to deliver these services, but the government controls the drugs, not us. We try to treat as many patients as we can, but if the Ministry strangles our supply, it doesn't work.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_9: I don't understand why you brought us on in the first place if you were going to fire us for doing the work.
feedback.loosen_drug_control_2: That will help a great deal. This way we can ensure the proper medications get where they need to go, and at the right cost.
feedback.clarification_of_roles_12: OK. I'm just trying to make this work as smoothly and efficiently as possible.

coach.dialogue: I'll ask, because this seems to be an ongoing problem: is that the NGO's position? They seem to be overstepping their role.

feedback.move_authority_to_ministry_4: The Ministry already has a lot going on, but I guess they can handle local hospital budgeting too.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: If they can't agree on a budget, I'm not going to have any cases to verify. And I like my job.

community_verifier.dialogue: If I were you, and I'm offering this as someone who lives here, ask the Ministry and your coach what to do. The Ministry gets the last call and the NGO doesn't.

problems.name: Process V Results Again
problems.initiating_dialogue: Fuel prices went up, so we had to reduce our outreach because of costs, and then we couldn't reach our targets... But if we don't get our bonus, next quarter it'll be even worse...

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: You can ask the Regional Director and providers directly. The NGO wants autonomy, so you'll have to do your research.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: No, they didn't meet their targets, but that doesn't mean my providers and their patients should suffer for it.

feedback.allow_payments_once_5: It's good to know we can count on you just like you can count on us in case of emergency.
feedback.deny_payment_5: We're struggling with these numbers as it is. It hurts patients when we don't have money to work with.

coach.dialogue: I don't think the NGO is managing as well as they could as they should have some contingency funding, but maybe in the end they do need more resources.

feedback.revise_indicators_at_end_of_year_4: Okay, at year's end I'll sit the fundholder down with the NGO and we'll figure out some realistic targets and prices.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I can confirm that they are not meeting their targets, but other than that I'm not much help.

community_verifier.dialogue: The other day I followed up with a woman who vaccinated her son against dengue right before the mosquitos got bad. The numbers aren't great, but if the payments stop, it will make the situation worse.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I'm worried that it's not just the prices of these services that's the problem. Even if I had all the money in the world, I couldn't spend it on the supplies I need, since my budget is handed to me by the NGO.

problems.name: Prescriptions
problems.initiating_dialogue: I've been interviewing patients, and at least at the clinics there's a serious quality of care issue. People have been leaving with what appears to be completely wrong prescriptions.

dep_minister_of_health.dialogue: That's unacceptable. I think it's time we looked for someone else to fulfill these duties. Letting the NGO go and contracting facilities directly would give us far better oversight.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: We must conduct an investigation right away. Begin by speaking directly with the health providers and find out why this is happening.

ngo_manager.dialogue: I run the entire health network of Zariba and can't be everywhere at once. In the end, I am responsible, but I'm not being given the support I need.

feedback.warning_18: Everyone who works for me is doing their best. I don't know what I can do without an increase in resources.
feedback.sanctions_16: I need an increase in resources to deal with this, not a cut! How can I fix this problem if I'm hamstrung by sanctions?

coach.dialogue: This sounds like we've been incentivising the wrong things. Adhering to best practices is much more important than satisfied patients. Let's rethink this.

feedback.reduce_incentives_for_customer_service_2: I know I pushed hard for patient satisfaction, but that might have been... misguided. Let's implement this and see what happens.
feedback.tie_incentives_directly_to_protocol_2: I'll work on implementing this change. I think this will prove to be a turning point in the program.
feedback.terminate_contract_at_end_of_year_10: I'll inform the NGO and begin transitioning into contracting directly with providers early next year.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: This is a mess. I'll take another look. It would be very easy for us to verify whether they're really following protocols.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: At first I was shocked to hear this, but the more I thought about it, the more it makes sense. Patients don't know the difference, and if we're incentivizing happy patients, the wrong medicine is better than no medicine.

problems.name: Missing Goals
problems.initiating_dialogue: I hate to say it, but things are not going well. The NGO is underperforming, and our indicators have not risen as predicted. We're thinking about cancelling the program next year, and returning to traditional financing.

director_regional_health_services.dialogue: As much as it pains me to say so, I agree with the Deputy Minister. We need to change our approach.

feedback.return_to_traditional_financing_2: Part of me feels like the past three years have been wasted, but I guess there's no sense in throwing good money out after bad. It's been a pleasure working with you.

ngo_manager.dialogue: The problem is at the level of providers and always has been. If we terminate the hospital's contract, we can find another provider to fill their role and salvage our project.

feedback.terminate_ngo_contract_8: If we couldn't make this work, nobody can. The past three years have been an unmitigated disaster. But I wish you luck.
feedback.grant_autonomy_to_providers_5: Let's schedule a meeting to discuss this at the end of the year. I might be able to persuade the Minister to give us one more year with an altered program.

coach.dialogue: There must be another solution here. I'm committed to making this program work. Even with new health providers and without the assistance of the NGO.

third_party_verifier.dialogue: I've heard a lot of complaining, but it amounts to finger pointing. Can you fire everybody? Except me, that is.

community_verifier.dialogue: Seems like you're getting yelled at by both sides. That's rough, but you'll figure it out.

hospital_administrator.dialogue: I heard through the grapevine what's happening. I know there have been issues, but I believe the problem is and has been the bureaucracy from the NGO's office. If you grant us autonomy to hire staff as needed and order supplies to fulfill our patients' needs, things have to improve.

feedback.terminate_hospital_contract_1: This is so disappointing. I did everything I could to make this program work and help people.

tactics.name: Lack of Information
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Community verifier says opinions about health care facilities aren't changing, and people are not changing much.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Most people have not heard about the changes.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_provider_ambassadors: This can begin next year if we revise the contracts to include it.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_invite_community_leaders: Like it or not, we're still outsiders or working for outsiders. It's a good idea to get some leaders on our side.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_word_of_mouth: This will only work if we keep doing good work, but word of mouth campaigns have worked in the past.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Misinformation
tactics.initiating_dialogue: People have been coming to facilities totally confused as they hear facilities are paid for service delivery, and yet they also pay for the services.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Misinformation is circulating about how the program works.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_funding_for_sensitiz: This should work as long as we can communicate how facilities operate. And we can get the materials printed.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_create_informational_pamphlet: Let's just hope the language is clear enough and we get the pamphlets in time.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Printing Issues
tactics.initiating_dialogue: We are running out of pamphlets at most facilities.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The printer we hired to create them is unreliable and keeps missing print deadlines, sometimes by many weeks. I could look for new printers, or we could let facilities produce their own materials. We'd need to provide equipment and materials, though.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: It'll cost more, but I guess this is what we get for going with the cheapest option. We'll have to find room for that in the budget.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_provide_health_facilities_wit: This ended up being more of a cost than we realized, since now we have employees printing these up, which cuts into their time. And if they all need ink at the same time, we're doomed.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_budget_for_printing_: Hopefully we aren't just throwing money at a problem, but somebody needs to do this. I'll reach out to the bulk printer and look into raising our quantities.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Overprescription
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The community verifier tells me doctors are prescribing unnecessary medicines, which puts a strain on patients' finances.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Patients aren't happy unless they leave the hospital with a prescription, so doctors prescribe them something either way.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_limit_prescriptions: If they need fewer, they'll have an empty pad burning a hole in their pocket. If they need more, it'll be a nightmare.
