feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_following_set_pro: We're counting on the promise of incentives outweighing the headache of a cranky patient, but it doesn't help people to give them a bunch of medicine they don't need.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_retrain_doctors: This is mostly a bedside manner problem, and reminding doctors they're allowed to say 'no' is a lot cheaper than paying them to.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Wrong Procedures
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Verifiers have identified that some patients are getting incorrect or unnecessary prescriptions.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: When patients require referral they often have insufficient funds to get there. Many doctors therefore prescribe or do whatever they can at their level instead of referring the patients to get the appropriate care elsewhere.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_create_robust_referral_system: If the problem persists, then our providers are not leveling with us. It should fix the problem, though.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_following_set_pro: I get it's annoying to reward people for not breaking the rules, but if they feel the referral process is such a pain, that's what we have to do.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_referrals: I hope we don't hear about unnecessary referrals next.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Infection Rates
tactics.initiating_dialogue: There's been a sharp increase in infections recently and it's probably because the number of clients have increased significantly. There are more and more women delivering in the facility, but there are concerns about quality.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Surprise! Sterilization protocols are not being followed and that's why women are getting these infections.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_sanitization_prot: It smacks of gold star rewards for kids. 'Wash your hands, children!' Oh well. As long as it doesn't drain the discretionary budget too much.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_best_practices: If we're going to increase the number of women delivering in the facility, we better make sure they receive quality care and not die because of it.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanction_providers_with_high_: If staff can't be bothered to follow sterilization guidelines, then we are well within our rights to sanction them.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Overprescription 2
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Our community verifier has informed us of more patients who have been prescribed more than five fancy medicines for something like a simple flu. They are then told to go to the private pharmacy to buy the drugs.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The private pharmacy is run by the doctor's nephew.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_best_practices_hi: Just make sure include patient treatment charts against protocols. We do not want to pay for services below standard.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanction_providers_performing: This is a serious problem. I hope this will solve it.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Inspection Failure
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The Ministry did a national accreditation review and quite a number of facilities have failed to meet the standards linked to the quality of care and safety of staff. I have some unverified horror stories, but even if they aren't true, anything close to that is alarming. It does not look good.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: They seem to be concentrating only on increasing the volume of patients, so while no one, thank God, is reusing syringes, people are getting over-prescribed, injected, etc, to attract as many patients as possible.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivise_best_practices_lo: There's no excuse for this: there are plenty of people to treat. We have to nip this in the bud.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanction_providers_who_fail_s: It's going to cost some money to make best practices possible, but it makes sense long-term.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Poor Effect of Campaign
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Incentivizing community health workers to do IEC for BCC does not seem to have the desired effect: there is no increase in women delivering in the facility.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: My investigation showed that it is not the fact that they don't know about delivery in a facility, but cultural issues. The women culturally are supposed to deliver at home and stay in the house for the first week. This is why we have very low numbers on institutional delivery and post-natal care indicators. The tradition is to deliver in the house with a Traditional Birth Assistant (TBA), often pressured by the mother-in-law. These unskilled deliveries lead to a lot of maternal deaths in the home.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivize_bring_women_to_fa: This sounds like a smart strategy.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivize_midwives_home_del: This may work. It will require more staff at the health facility, though if midwives travel to a house, you will need another to cover the clinic. We will also need to be mindful of quality and ensure they have all the equipment and the conditions to deliver in the home.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_leave_things_as_is_2: We might not need to spend all the money for this staff, but if not, we should probably cut the program at year's end.
feedback_dialogue.observe: If we don't engage it'll probably just fizzle out.

tactics.name: Poor Voucher Usage
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The manager of the voucher agency is concerned. We don't know why at this point, but we're not hitting our targets for voucher use. Do you want me to investigate this? Or shall we just observe for now?
tactics.investigate_dialogue: It's possible that people don't know about the services for some reason. A more targeted information campaign could be of use. It also seems that people are having difficulty getting to hospitals. Here are our recommendations:

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_add_travel_vouchers: That's a worthwhile idea, and it should help people reach health facilities.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_information_campaign: I'll contact the providers and let them know they must do more to explain their services.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_budget_for_outreach: I will make the arrangements. As long as there are enough nurses available to carry out these outreach activites, this should help.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Wrong Number of Cases
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The Verifier just let me know that the number of cases reported for the voucher program appears to be incorrect.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: I verified this with the providers, and they claim that this was an unintended mistake. We could just issue a nonpayment, or we could issue sanctions. Alternatively, I could investigate further for evidence of fraud.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: My investigation did not turn up any hard evidence of fraud.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_warning_t1: I'll issue the warning and let the fundholder know that payments should be withheld for the false cases.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanctions_t1: We'll levy sanctions, then. My analysis suggests they can afford to pay the penalty.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Transport Issues
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Incentivizing community health workers to do an IEC on BCC for deliveries still doesn't appear to be having the effect we'd hoped for. It's not causing any harm but we also can't prove it is helping.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Apart from cultural issues, it appears transport costs are preventing women from delivering in facilities. The health facilities seem to have some ideas for how address them.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_provide_family_transport_ince: This may work but will require some coordinating. Hope it will pay off!
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_end_campaign_t2: Leave it to the health facility to decide how they will attain the results.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_leave_things_as_is_3: We can wait it out a bit longer.
feedback_dialogue.observe: If we don't engage it'll probably just fizzle out.

tactics.name: Voucher Acceptance
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The community verifier tells me that some people were turned away from a hospital in the highlands when they tried to pay with vouchers. They demanded cash!
tactics.investigate_dialogue: I spoke with the administrator of the hospital, and they said they don't have the money they need to keep the hospital open without the cash. It takes weeks for them to be paid for the vouchers, so they can't afford to accept them.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_expedite_voucher_payment: It could be better to shorten the process of verification and to ensure a timely payment.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanction_the_provider: They've shown flagrant disregard for the letter and spirit of the contract. We can find another hospital that can do the same job.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_voucher_capacity_building: I will take time with providers to explain the payment procedures so that they can better plan for their expenditures.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: False Declarations
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The Voucher Agency Manager just called to tell me they found false declarations in the reports from the providers. These look to be invented cases.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The hospital adminstrators deny they have made fraudulent claims, but the numbers they submit are impossible. It could be lower-level employees making false claims.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: The providers seem to be encouraging their workers to bring in vouchers by offering bonuses.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_warning_t2: The senior staff management should be personally verifying reports before the third party verifier sees it. This is fraud, and not acceptable.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanctions_t2: This warrants a strong response. If it continues, we might need to go further and look for other providers in the area.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_employee_capacity_building: We'll focus on training and emphasizing the proper way to do reporting.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: No Effect
tactics.initiating_dialogue: This BCC campaign does not seem to add value. We have tried different things, but the indicators don't seem to be improving. There are some religious and political pressures to halt this campaign as well.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Some people say the campaign should be ended; they want more children to vote and feel the promotion of family planning goes against this. Maybe the campaign messages need to be revised accordingly for cultural sensitivity, with a focus on family spacing rather than a focus on averting pregnancies. Others want it halted altogether. It's a minority that is opposed to this, but very vocal with the elections coming up.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: This seems tied to the election. The conservative candidate for governor is claiming he wants more votes, so more children! We could speak to him directly, perhaps?

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_revise_language_in_campaign_t: We could write some copy about how our language is inflammatory, but if you have actual inflammation, real medicine helps! No? Okay, I'll tone down the copy.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_halt_campaign_t2: It's not going to raise awareness to stop advertising. Some nationalist politician is jeopardizing public health to gain traction.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_request_meeting_with_candidat: I admire you wanting to sit down with this politico. I think it'll frustrate you to no end, but I respect you for it.
feedback_dialogue.observe: If we don't engage it'll probably just fizzle out.

tactics.name: Running Out of Vouchers
tactics.initiating_dialogue: I'm getting reports that the Agency is running out of vouchers to give out. It could be a temporary shortage, or a systemic issue.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The printer is located in the Capitol City, and they are overloaded by demmand, and it takes too long for new shipments of printed vouchers to arrive. I could start looking for another printer. Or I could investigate whether they could be produced locally.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: It could be done at the local level with our cooperation. It would cost some money to set up a process in each region.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_seek_another_printer: No other printers seems to be able to meet our demand. We could contract two printers to share the burden, but that would be a management challenge.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_contract_multiple_printers: I'll make the arrangements. It will be  a hassle dealing with two or more printers and distributors, but the benefits outweigh the downsides.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_print_vouchers_locally: I'll make the arrangements. With any luck, this will solve the shortage.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Voucher Issues
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The community verifier tells me they've seen eligible people looking for vouchers and not being able to get them.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: It seems that supply problems have been mostly solved, so it must be a distribution problem. They offered to put us in contact with another community organization to help distrubute these, we can inform the voucher agency. Another option would be to sanction the agency.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: There are community-based organizations in the concerned catchment area that the Voucher Agency could contract.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_contract_organization_to_help: I'll get in touch with them and talk about establishing a contract with a Community-Based Organization.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanction_voucher_agency: I will advise the fund holder to withhold payment.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: What Is Covered
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The community organization has reported that some individuals are going to facilities and returning without being able to attend health information sessions, and others say they have been told not to 'waste their time' at clinics and hospitals.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: We conducted interviews on this, and it seems that people are showing up at the clinic expecting cash transfers for things not covered. They get so upset they leave without any services and are telling people to stay away.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_broaden_what_is_covered: I'll add this to the itinerary when contracts come up for review. This could get more people into facilities to receive the services we are emphasizing.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_information_campaign_to_expla: I'll inform providers they need to act on this. Once people understand how this program works, this problem should go away.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: CCT Qualification Confusion
tactics.initiating_dialogue: There is some confusion on who qualifies for cash transfers. This is supposed to target the poorest people from the highlands, but according to reports some people from the Capitol City and larger settlements have been requesting and receiving funds.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The policy itself seems to contain some ambiguities. A revision of the policy's inclusion/exclusion criterea could be the solution. I can look into hiring a third party to handle that. The policy also seems to be confusing to some providers. We could retrain them, and that might solve the problem.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: One of the hospital administrators has offered to revise the inclusion/exclusion policies to make it clearer for their staff. With our approval, of course. This would save us the cost of hiring a third party to revise them, if you trust the administrator to do it.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_retrain: I'll instruct the facility managers to institute a mandatory retraining for all staff.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_hire_third_party_to_rewrite: We'll launch a bidding for a qualified third party right away.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_hospital_administrator_revise: The Hospital Administrator will redefine the inclusion/exclusion criteria and bring clarity on required documents to be verified by the staff.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: CCT Penetration
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The targeted communities are not responding as well as they could to the CCT program. People are using the services, but the numbers in the poorest towns are not improving.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: It could be the incentives are not properly allocated. Alternatively, there could be a social or cultural barrier that we did not foresee. I could investigate this.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: Some women have said they are uncomfortable giving birth anywhere but their own house. We could begin a campaign to counter this belief, or even pay local midwives for bringing women into facilities to give birth.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_incentives: By raising the incentives, we can bring more women into these clinics.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_cultural_campaign: It will be a challenge to convince women to change their ways. I hope we are up to it!
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Underutilization
tactics.initiating_dialogue: For some reason, people just aren't taking advantage of this program as much as they should be. Our projections were flawed somehow.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: After conducting surveys, it's clear that the incentives we identified just aren't worth it to most people.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: There may be some social or cultural barrier at play here that is discouraging people from accepting these incentives. Changing the incentives all together, and repackaging the program seems advisable.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_incentives_t2: We just need to find the right level to be attractive.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_use_a_different_incentive: Let's go back to the ethnography and try to figure out the right kind of incentive and how to present this program in a way that will be attractive to the most people.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Payment Inconsistency
tactics.initiating_dialogue: I have been hearing complaints from clients that the CCT payments are not being paid on time. They are losing faith in the program.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: It seems the Ministry of Finance has been delaying payment on these due to poor communication within their department. We should either push them to speed up, or consider cutting back the CCT program, if we don't have the capacity to process it.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_push_minfin_to_expedite_payme: I'll draft a memo to the Minister's office right away stressing the importance of timely payments.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_cut_back_cct: I'll try to work with the Ministry to determine their capacity and reasses the scale of the program for the coming year.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Cash Transfer Confusion
tactics.initiating_dialogue: I've been noticing a drop off in the fourth quarter of demand-side incentive customers. Thought you should know.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Some clients are having difficulty understanding. They do eventually receive their money, but it takes too long, and by then, they've complained to others, who are discouraged from coming.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: It seems like people expect to leave the hospital with money. When they don't receive it, they get mad, and say they'll tell others not to come.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_expedite_cct_payment: We can revise the payment procedures.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_fund_info_campaign: Adjusting customer expectations should help a little. I'll make the preparations.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_embed_cct_officer_at_faciliti: This will take a while to implement. I'll start the preparations right away.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Resistance to Outreach
tactics.initiating_dialogue: So far, our outreach team has not made a meaningful impact on facility births. There seems to be resistance to the program.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The women culturally are supposed to deliver at home and stay in the house for the first week. This is why we have very low numbers on institutional delivery. The tradition is to deliver in the house with a traditional birth assistant, often pressured by the mother-in-law. These unskilled deliveries lead to a lot of maternal deaths in the home.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivize_midwives_home_del: This would be a good deal better than the traditionally conducted home births.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_delivery_info_campaign: We have had mixed results relying on information campaigns in the past. Let's see how this turns out.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivize_bring_women_to_fa: Good idea. Build in a reason for them to cooperate with us instead of fighting the program.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Field Records
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The health workers working in communities have had some issues with recordkeeping in the fields. The forms often have mistakes or don't show up to the health facility in time.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The verifiers have found that the health facilities are reporting inaccurate data on the actual services provided. We could issue the health facilities a warning.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: In fact, it looks like the outreach workers are unable to make it to the health facility regularly enough. This leads to under-reporting and thus health facilities and outreach workers do not receive all the incentives they are eligible for each month. Maybe there is not enough awareness of what they lose out on. We can retrain them, or start by verifying and paying them on a quarterly basis instead of monthly.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_warning_t3: I will tell the providers that they must be responsible for their employees.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_retrain_outreach_nurses: I'll go ahead and block out some time for a training session.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_move_to_quarterly_basis: Alright, with any luck adjusting the pay-cycle might get the results we want.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Supply Chain
tactics.initiating_dialogue: My team has been conducting some interviews for monitoring purposes, and the outreach staff claim they don't have adequate supplies to perform in the field.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: This speaks to quality of care. The spokesperson at the Ministry of Health says that there are problems with the supply chain from the central level. The Ministry says we need to incentivise following protocols more strongly. Then facilities will be able to pay for better supplies.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: My analysis shows that if anything, more nurses would be of a benefit, but given the supply issues, hiring more right now wouldn't be prudent.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_introduce_quality_of_care_inc: This is the only solution that I can reconcile with the data.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_strengthen_supply_chain: This will take some care to achieve, but with the limitations on our staff, it may be the best option.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Organizational Inefficiency
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The outreach team is not performing to the standards laid out in the program. The data shows they have not been working efficiently, and they've left many opportunities to deliver services on the table.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The explanation for the inefficiencies is that the staff is just too large. These are largely appointed people--not all of them are even qualified. And since incentives are being split among so many people, there is dissatisfaction with the level of incentive payments.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: Cutting staff would alleviate the problem, but it could cause political problems, since the appointments were made as part of an election. Simply paying more is another way to go.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_reduce_outreach_staff: This is a hard decision to make, but I think this will be better in the long run.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_leave_things_as_is: Not a bad idea. This could work itself out, especially if dissatisfied outreach workers step down.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_outreach_incentive_l: This is an expensive choice, but I see the logic.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Drop-off in Promotional Services
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The Community Verifier tells me that there has been a large drop-off in simple health activities such as promoting hand-washing and sanitation at the household level. These aren't incentivized services, but they are very important.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The outreach staff has been spending time searching out the last children in each community who have not been vaccinated, and hanging around pregnant women's homes so they can refer them for the incentive bonus. They do this instead of the promotional services, since that's where the incentives push them.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivize_promotional_servi: This should ensure that these fundamental services take place.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_warn_outreach_staff: We'll tell them that this behavior is not acceptable, and that further steps may be taken if need be.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_change_nothing: Perhaps this will work itself out in time.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Unusual Claims
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The third-party verifier has found some errors in the community verifier's reporting on patient satisfaction. We should look into this.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The problem could be a simple one: satisfaction is difficult to objectively measure. Revising our surveys might be in order. Alternatively, the problem could be the community verifiers themselves. They may just need more training to carry out interviews in a way that avoids bias.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: I looked into the community verifiers' methodology more closely, including who was actually hired. It seems that many of their employees have close ties to the health facilities. This makes them biased, unfortunately. We may need to address this directly by reorganizing their staff.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_train_community_verifiers: These mistakes are fairly common, but with good training we can avoid them.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_revise_cv_surveys: We'll take a closer look at what's being asked and root out any biases we find.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_reorganize_cv_staff: I think this is the only way to counter an inherent bias in reporting.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Delayed Scores
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The health facilities have been complaining that they are not receiving payments on time for their client satisfaction scores. If they're not being paid on time, their staff might decide it's not worth doing any longer, and the program could fall apart.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: I checked with the Ministry of Finance, and this time it doesn't look like it's their fault. The community verifiers seem to be the bottleneck. They're not returning scores on time, which leads to delays. If payments were quarterly, this could give them some flexibility, but they may not be incentivized strongly enough to act.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: I interviewed some of the community verifiers, and they say that when they go to neighboring communities, it's hard to find patients' houses. Streed addresses are missing in rural areas, and the road conditions are bad in Zariba, as you know. Contracting verifiers for each community would counteract this.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_incentivize_timely_scores: This is a direct approach. I expect we'll see results soon.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_shift_to_quarterly_basis_2: This could give them the time they need to submit reports. Payments will at least be on time this way.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_hire_local_verifiers: This will be a logistical challenge, but it may be the only way to overcome these barriers.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Patient Satisfaction Not Improving
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Good news and bad news. The good news is, scores are now being reported on time, and payments are being made. The bad news is, the patient satisfaction scores are not actually going up.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The health providers need to take action if they want to earn the full incentives on offer. The failure seems to be coming at the point of data analysis. Either the data itself is not sufficiently detailed, which means the community verifiers aren't doing their job, or the health providers just need to devote more time to data analysis.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: The health providers want to make use of this data, but they just don't have the capacity. It's time we stepped in, if we ever want to see an improvement.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_retrain_verifiers_on_data: I'll make sure this happens. Still, I wonder about the analysis side, and what the health providers may be missing.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_retrain_providers_on_data: Building capacity in this area will be sure to benefit them now and in the future. It's important to know how to read and analyze data to make improvements.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Complaints
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Service deliveries are increasing, but slower than intended.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Community verifier says people are talking about bad service at facilities. We could incentivise this directly, or just increase incentives on service deliveries and let the facilities work out how to best increase services.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_directly_incentivise_service_: If patients feel better about the care they're getting, the numbers should pick up.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_incentives_service_d: As care providers get more per treatment, they'll be more pleasant and it would make sense for patients to have better experiences.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Poor Surveys
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Surveys are showing that trust in healthcare facilities is not rising.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The problem may be caused by bad personal interactions with individual health workers.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_directly_incensitive_service_: Patients can be really demanding, but if you get paid for making them happy, that should prioritize that for them.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sensitization_campaign: I'm thinking, for effectiveness' sake, we shouldn't just tell doctors to not be jerks. But sometimes they could stand to hear just that.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Fraud Alert
tactics.initiating_dialogue: There has been an increase in fraudulent service claims since the first year.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: It seems that when we raised incentives near the end of the first year, this tempted some providers to file fraudulent claims.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_sanction_these_providers: This is probably more cost effective, since everyone should get in line after a little punishment. And that's cheaper than finding new providers.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_cut_incentives: They're already stealing from us, basically. Smaller scores probably won't do much to ameliorate that.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_cancel_contracts: This will create a lot of work for us, but I understand these hospitals abused your trust. If patients suffer too, it is the providers' fault.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Candidates
tactics.initiating_dialogue: None of the hospitals or facilities have managed to hire as many staff from the highland regions as per the criteria established in the quality checklist. They haven't attained the score, and thus lose out on part of the incentive for this quarter.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: There just aren't enough qualified medical staff in the highland regions that can be hired to meet the targets established in the quality checklist.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_enhance_highland_training_fac: We might have to pay people to relocate, but good staff is vital.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_lower_requirements_and_increa: Lowering requirements is going to come back and bite us unless we're very lucky.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: No Effect
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Health facilities have been hiring more nurses from the highlands as requested, but they now claim the extra time it takes to train them and to relocate them is not worth the incentives we are offering for this.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: People from the highlands do like seeing people from their region when they go to the hospital. The incentives for this could be increased to make it more attractive. However, it might be prudent to analyze the effect they are having in a more detailed way to see if they are worth it, though.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: The impact of the nurses seems to be negligible so far. We could increase the incentives to encourage more of them to be hired and see if the impact increases, or we could just let facilities hire whoever they wish to attain the results.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_incentives_for_attra: This should make it more attractive for facilities to hire these nurses.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_let_hospitals_select_hires: This is more in line with the principle of autonomy.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Make Aesthetic Improvements
tactics.initiating_dialogue: Providers have been requested to establish a beautiful garden at the facility in order to attract patients and attain the bonus. They are complaining that the focus on the garden is a waste of time and money, and are asking that we not require them to complete this.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: It seems that most customers do not really care about the garden. I don't think it will have too much of an impact. The staff seems to like it, though.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: I believe letting the facility management concentrate on delivering services instead of establishing a garden would improve things a good deal in terms of patient satisfaction.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_continue_with_plan_aesthetic: I'll tell them to follow the program as it was designed.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_grant_permission: I'll let them know that they can cease renovations and concentrate on services.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Road Issues
tactics.initiating_dialogue: There have been a number of late deliveries.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: The late deliveries seem to be due to heavy rains suffered this year washing out roads, according to the company. We could penalize them, or advise them to find better routes--they can even use the train if it works better--all we want is results.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: Even as unreliable as the train is, it may be better than depending on roads. We could end the contract and go back to using the trains, or continue to try our luck with the shipping company.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_penalize_delivery_co: I'll inform their representative of the penalty. If they can't meet our demands, we'll need to go further next time.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_switch_to_train_service: I know we had trouble with the trains before, but they aren't as vulnerable as roads.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Strike
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The private company we have hired to deliver medicine has gone on strike.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: There's no telling how long this strike could last. We need to find a temporary solution, at least, or look into more permenant alternatives.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: There is one other ground transport service we could use. There is also a new service that ships by air that would be more expensive, but could be more reliable.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_terminate_contract_at_end_of_: OK, we'll discuss this at the end of the year. The old way of doing things wasn't great, which is why we switched in the first place, but it'll work as until we can find a better solution.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_hire_another_ground_based_ser: We probably should have gone with them first. We didn't because they're a little more expensive, but that's because they offer benefits and that sort of thing. They're less likely to strike.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_hire_air_service: This will cut deeper into our coffers, but they have a good track record.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Raising Rates
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The shipping company we hired says they have to raise their rates starting at the next contract year.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Our only options seem to be paying the new rate, which would have to come out of our discretionary budget, or trying to find a cheaper option.
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: It seems that everyone's raising their rates, so switching companies won't help us much. We could attempt to negotiate the price down.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_pay_new_rate: We'll have to get a little creative with the budget for this, but what else can we do?
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_negotiate: They wouldn't budge. Didn't hurt to try, though.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_return_to_train_shipping: So we're firing the shipping company and going back to the train? Works for me.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: No Effect
tactics.initiating_dialogue: According to providers, the campaign is struggling because they don't have the staff to both support the campaign and perform necessary healthcare functions. We could address this directly, either by funding new hires or increasing incentives, or we could halt the campaign for now to assess things.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: They do appear short staffed. Providing funding for new hires could help, or we could reoganize our sensitization strategy.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_provide_funding_to_hire_new_s: Everywhere I've worked we were short staffed and were told to make due. We're telling people to do a job and giving them the money to do it. We are in uncharted territory!
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_increase_incentives_for_meeti: This could certainly spur people to meet goals. I'm worried, though, that they're spread thin already.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_reevaluate_whether_this_campa: We might not need to spend all the money for this staff, but if not, we should probably cut the program at year's end.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Overexposure
tactics.initiating_dialogue: The response to our campaign seems to be dropping off significantly. Should I look into the cause of this?
tactics.investigate_dialogue: From what I have been able to discover, the campaigners are focusing a bit too strongly on what misinformation is being spread, and what the sources are. This is creating more suspicion about what the health facilities are doing and why.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_refocus_campaign_staff: This will be more constructive, no doubt.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_end_campaign: We can talk again at the end of the year and decide if this is worth the expenditure.
feedback_dialogue.observe: OK, we'll wait and see if anything changes.

tactics.name: Backlash
tactics.initiating_dialogue: There has been some backlash about this campaign from users of traditional medicine. They consider it insulting and inflammatory.
tactics.investigate_dialogue: Some people want the campaign to be revised for cultural sensitivity, while others want it halted all together. It's a minority that is opposed to this, but very vocal. I wonder what has them so upset after more than two years?
tactics.investigate_further_dialogue: It turns out there is an election for regional governor coming up, and the conservative candidate is stirring the pot against foreign influences, including us! We could speak with him directly, perhaps.

feedback_dialogue.unlockable_revise_language_in_campaign: We could write some copy about how our language is inflammatory, but if you have actual inflammation, real medicine helps! No? OK. I'll tone down the copy.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_halt_campaign: It's not going to raise awareness to stop advertising. Some nationalist politician is jeopardizing public health to gain traction.
feedback_dialogue.unlockable_request_meeting_with_candidat: I admire you wanting to sit down with this politico. I think it'll frustrate you to no end, but I respect you for it.
feedback_dialogue.observe: If we don't engage it'll probably just fizzle out.

phase_1_initial.text: Welcome to Zariba! Explore the world, learn about the health situation, and put together an RBF program proposal to pilot in the next year. Raise your indicators by 30, 35, and 40%!

phase_1_skip_tutorial.text: You can choose to skip these help messages and go directly to the map to begin making your plan. You will not visit the Capital City and will automatically receive respective plan options found there. Skip tutorial and Capital City?

phase_1_rahb.text: Click on Rahb, your RBF Plan Supervisor and then choose “learn more” to see what she has to say. To continue the conversation, choose a highlighted topic.

phase_1_interactions_counter.text: When you select a dialogue option that has an icon next to it, this number decreases. This indicates how many conversations you can have before you're forced to leave the city. Try asking Rahb something else.

phase_1_move_around.text: Click, hold and drag or use the arrow keys to take a look around and talk to the Ministry officials to the right. Remember, once you’ve heard about a topic, you can still ask about something else, as long as you have conversation points left!

phase_1_unlocked_something.text: This notification means you just unlocked something! Some topics can lead to finding routes to new cities, new options for your program proposal, and new conversation points with other people! You never know what you might find!

phase_1_plan_creation_screen.text: At any time you can access the program creation screen to start forming your RBF proposal. Click here to open this screen.

phase_1_tactics.text: Here are all the tactics you have unlocked so far. As you gather more tactics by talking to people, you can draft your program proposal by clicking on a tactic and dragging it into a blank space on the right.

phase_1_tactic_slots.text: Each slot has a priority level. Policies placed higher up will be prioritized meaning their benefits and consequences will be amplified. You can change your program proposal any time before the final submission.  Click here to close your notebook.

phase_1_continue_talking.text: Talk to the rest of the Capitol city officials to learn more about Zariba and the challenges it faces!

phase_1_map.text: You can click and drag to see different parts of the Zaribian map.

phase_1_map_cost.text: Every time you travel to a new city it will cost some number of days, depending on the route. When you run out of days you are forced to make your RBF proposal and this phase of the game ends.

phase_1_city_routes.text: You can travel to a new city if a yellow route is active between your location and the new city. Try clicking on Malcom or Crup now.

phase_1_travel.text: Read the description to decide whether you want to travel to this city. Click the visit button, or click cancel and choose another city.

phase_1_conversation_points.text: You still have conversation points in this city! Remember, you can see your remaining interactions at the upper-left. Click on the map icon to return to the city.

phase_1_end.text: Congratulations! You finished your trip through Zariba, now it’s time to confirm the details of your plan using everything you learned. Once you’ve set the policies and their priority, click the submit plan button and we’ll see how the pilot year

phase_2_start.text: Welcome! You are the manager for Zariba’s new RBF program. The results of the pilot year were deemed acceptable, and now we’ll be implementing it at scale. You will be making operational decisions to make sure everything runs smoothly. Your goal will be to manage the program and increase the three main indicators: Vaccinations, Facility Births, and Quality of Care by 25, 30, and 35 percent respectively.

phase_2_skip.text: Over the next three years, you will be contacted by colleagues in the field, presented with information, and given the opportunity to conference with others before making a decision. We’ll help you through your first challenge if you like.

phase_2_first_problem.text: The year has just begun, and it looks like you’ve got your first problem. Take a moment to read the issue now. There is a default solution that you can decide upon, or you can contact colleagues in the field to get more information.

phase_2_conferencing.text: You can receive advice from up to three people during any problem, so choose carefully. Look at your contacts and select one now.

phase_2_conference_action.text: This contact has given you new information! Some contacts just provide background context, others give you ideas for new options you can take to solve the problem. You can conference with up to two more before you make your decision.

phase_2_actions.text: Once you know what course of actions you want to take or you have conferenced with three people, select an action from the options below to implement it. We’ll let you finish this problem on your own.

phase_2_feedback.text: Well done! Your indicators have changed based on the decision you made. You must confirm the feedback you have received about your decision.

phase_2_supervisor.text: Somebody has come to you with a new problem. First, though, let's go talk to Rahb, your Program Supervisor, who will have additional messages for you. Click the tab.

phase_2_supervisor_opened.text: The problems Rahb brings you work a little differently. She will explain the situation and offer a solution. You can send her out to research the problem and come back with more information. This can open up new options for you, but it takes time. You decide on a solution just like the main screen problems. Try one now.

phase_2_timer.text: The year will pass in real time. This timer tells you how long you have to complete your main screen problem. Since time is ticking, you must be careful to work efficiently, and switch back and forth between the main screen and the Supervisor tab. Time will start now! Good luck!

phase_2_year_end.text: Congratulations, you made it to the end of your first year! At the end of each year, you will be given a review of your work, and asked to make an important decision that will affect the future of the program in a more significant way. Choose wisely!

ui_text.copy_byline: A discovery game for teaching the principles of Results Based Financing
ui_text.copy_email_error: We couldn't find that email. If this is your first time playing, please register.
ui_text.copy_phase_selection: Welcome back to Zariba! You can explore the world again and create a new proposal, or implement a program created by you or another player.
ui_text.copy_plan_selection: Select one of these programs to implement.
ui_text.copy_plan_screen_instructions_tactics: Drag and drop options into your program proposal. You can change your proposal at any time.
ui_text.copy_plan_screen_name_prompt: Give your program proposal a name.
ui_text.copy_pilot_year: Congratulations! Your progam is now being piloted in Zariba. Please wait to see results of your pilot year...
ui_text.copy_out_of_interactions: You've spoken to as many people as you can, and it is now time to move on. Take a look at the map to choose your next destination.
ui_text.copy_out_of_days: You traveled around Zariba and met many interesting people, but you are now out of days. Time to submit your final program proposal!
ui_text.copy_city_visit: Click Visit to travel here and enter the city.
ui_text.copy_city_pass_through: You've already visited this city, but you can pass through it by clicking Continue.
ui_text.copy_city_extra_day: You've already been here, but you can re-enter the city to talk to people you may have missed. Click Re-enter below to spend an extra day.
ui_text.copy_city_pass_through_extra_day: Do you want to go this way? From here, you could re-enter the city, or just continue on to your next destination.
ui_text.copy_blocked_route:
You return to the train station and learn that bad weather has triggered a landslide to the east. The train tracks between Mile and Zima have been destroyed.
A young man tugs on your shirt and grins. He says he drives a produce truck and can get you to Kibari, the heart of the highlands. "From there," he says, "you can get anywhere!"

unlockables.title: Incentivise Providers to Deliver Services
description: This gives bonuses to providers that deliver more services by incentivising providers to reach specific goals.

unlockables.title: Incentivise Providers to Follow Protocols
description: This would stress providers to follow protocols in order to receive incentives and create consequences for noncompliance.

unlockables.title: Contract Outside Organization to Administer Program
description: If there is poor infrastructure or government control, contracting an NGO to manage this role might be ideal.

unlockables.title: Contract Private Company to Deliver Supplies
description: If public infrastructure is not delivering needed supplies, contracting a private company might ensure they get there.

unlockables.title: Grant Providers Autonomy
description: This will allow providers the autonomy to suit the needs of their local communities instead of waiting on the Ministry decisions.

unlockables.title: Improve Patient and Provider Relationship
description: This would help improve patient/provider relationships in order to increase use of important services long term.

unlockables.title: Make Aesthetic Improvements
description: This would provide facilities with proper maintenance, renovations, paint, new uniforms for staff, or other upgrades.

unlockables.title: Hire Nurses From the Highlands Region
description: This would initiate the hiring of local nurses to work in health facilities, leading to a possible economy boost in poor regions.

unlockables.title: Vouchers For Services
description: This would provide vouchers to poor people so they can receive necessary services at a greatly reduced price.

unlockables.title: Conditional Cash Transfer
description: This makes the transfer of money or goods conditional on using the health services that we wish to incentivise.

unlockables.title: Outreach
description: When travel is difficult for patients, this will bring more health care workers directly to their communities.

unlockables.title: Information Campaign to Change Cultural Customs and Behavior
description: This would launch an educational information campaign that could help change dangerous cultural customs and behaviors.

unlockables.title: Information Campaign to Counter Misinformation
description: This would launch an educational information campaign to combat misinformation about health services and facility care.

unlockables.title: Information Campaign to Explain Changes to System
description: This would launch an educational information campaign to explain major changes in the health system.
